tutorial.speak:
Let's import your data from Excel or CSV into B1.church Admin. Start by clicking Settings in the left sidebar.
Then click Import/Export in the top navigation.
In the Import/Export tool, click the Data Source dropdown and select B1 Import Zip.
You'll see a link to download sample files. Click here to download the sample B1 import zip file.
Once downloaded, locate the sampleImport zip file on your desktop and unzip it.
Open the unzipped folder. You'll see files like people.csv, households.csv, photos folder, and others. These show you the required format for your data.
Open people.csv to see the format. Replace the sample data with your own data, but keep the header row unchanged. Save the file as people.csv You can also edit other CSV files as needed or delete the sample data.
If you want to import photos, replace the sample photos with your own photos. Photos are 400 X 300 pixels. Photo numbers correspond to the importKey column in your people.csv file. You can delete the sample photos and add your own. Make sure each photo number matches the importKey for the correct person. Now drag all the files to your desktop. When your files are ready, create a new zip file with all the contents. On Mac, select all files, right-click, and choose Compress. On PC, select the folder, right-click, and choose Send to Compressed folder.
Then return to B1 and click Upload.
In the file picker, select your prepared zip file you just created and click Open.
B1 will process your file and show you a preview of the data. Review the imported records and click Continue to Destination at the bottom.
On the Destination screen, make sure B1 Database is selected. Review the summary showing how many records will be imported.
Scroll down and click Start Transfer to begin importing your data.
Wait while B1 imports your data. You'll see a progress indicator showing which items are being imported. This may take a few moments depending on how much data you have.
When the import is complete, click Go to B1 to return to your B1.church Admin dashboard.
